title: envFiles
description: This file contains the environment variables required for the application's configuration. Each variable is explained to help with setting up a secure and functional environment.

controllers.title: MONGODB_URI
controllers.description: The connection string used to connect to the MongoDB database. It includes credentials (username and password), the MongoDB cluster URL, and additional options like retry logic.

controllers.title: NEXTAUTH_SECRET
controllers.description: A secret key used by NextAuth.js to sign and encrypt tokens, ensuring that the authentication process is secure.

controllers.title: JWT_SECRET
controllers.description: The secret key used to sign JSON Web Tokens (JWT) for authentication and authorization. This key should be strong and unique.

controllers.title: EMAIL_SERVER_HOST
controllers.description: The SMTP server host used to send emails. In this case, the application is using Gmail's SMTP server.

controllers.title: EMAIL_SERVER_PORT
controllers.description: The port used by the email server. Common ports for SMTP servers are 587 (TLS) and 465 (SSL).

controllers.title: EMAIL_SERVER_USER
controllers.description: The username (usually the email address) used to authenticate with the SMTP server.

controllers.title: EMAIL_SERVER_PASSWORD
controllers.description: The password or app-specific password for authenticating with the SMTP server. For security, it is recommended to use app-specific passwords when using services like Gmail.

controllers.title: EMAIL_FROM
controllers.description: The email address and name that will appear as the sender of the emails. This is typically formatted as a name followed by the email in quotes.

controllers.title: FRONTEND_URL
controllers.description: The URL of the frontend application. This is used for CORS policies and other front-end related configurations.

controllers.title: ALLOWED_ORIGINS
controllers.description: Comma-separated list of allowed origins for Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS). This restricts which front-end origins can interact with the backend.
